p: Portulaca oleracea is listed by the World Health Organization (WHO) as one of the most used medicinal and edible plants, which is packed full of nutrients, vitamins, and minerals. Portulaca oleracea has been widely used as a potherb and herb in the Mediterranean, central European, and Asian countries (Iranshahy et al. 2017). Portulaca oleracea has been used as a traditional Chinese medicine (TCM) in China, acting as a febrifuge, antiseptic, vermifuge, and so forth (Rahimi et al. 2019). It is considered as a beneficial herb in the world and contains antimicrobial, antidiabetic, and anti-inflammatory properties (Iranshahy et al. 2017). In this study, the complete chloroplast genome of Portulaca oleracea was characterized and generated, which can be used for the active ingredient of TCM and drug development in this species.
